	<div class="article-wrap-inner">

					<div class="featured-thumb">

		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

data-image-title="LucasArts_Hero_NoCopy.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://i2.wp.com/tictechbuzz.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/LucasArts_Hero_NoCopy.jpg?fit=300%2C169&amp;ssl=1" />			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

                               <div class="news-text-wrap">
                                    <h3>
                                        <a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/a-guide-to-platform-fees-apple-app-store-youtube-twitch-and-more/#comment-349"><span class="commented-post">A guide to platform fees: Apple App Store, YouTube, Twitch, and more</span></a>
                                    </h3> 

                                    <span class="comment-author">By xvj3gsdfghhfies.link</span>

                                                                        
                                    <span class="posted-date">October 17, 2020</span>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

		};</p>

	});</p>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

		};</p>

	});</p>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

		};</p>

	});</p>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

		};</p>

	});</p>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

		};</p>

	});</p>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

		};</p>

/>			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

		};</p>

                                <div class="news-item three-column-item">
                                    <div class="news-thumb">

			jQuery( document.body ).on( 'click', 'a.share-twitter', function() {
				// If there's another sharing window open, close it.
				if ( 'undefined' !== typeof windowOpen ) {
					windowOpen.close();
				}
				windowOpen = window.open( jQuery( this ).attr( 'href' ), 'wpcomtwitter', 'menubar=1,resizable=1,width=600,height=350' );
				return false;
			});
var windowOpen;
			jQuery( document.body ).on( 'click', 'a.share-facebook', function() {
				// If there's another sharing window open, close it.
				if ( 'undefined' !== typeof windowOpen ) {
					windowOpen.close();
				}
				windowOpen = window.open( jQuery( this ).attr( 'href' ), 'wpcomfacebook', 'menubar=1,resizable=1,width=600,height=400' );
				return false;
			});
</script>
	<iframe src='https://widgets.wp.com/likes/master.html?ver=202042#ver=202042' scrolling='no' id='likes-master' name='likes-master' style='display:none;'></iframe>

<article id="post-4385" class="post-4385 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-games">
	<div class="article-wrap-inner">

					<div class="featured-thumb">

		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>

			});
		};</p>
<p>		(function(d, s, id){

		}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));
	});</p>

			jQuery( document.body ).on( 'click', 'a.share-twitter', function() {
				// If there's another sharing window open, close it.
				if ( 'undefined' !== typeof windowOpen ) {
					windowOpen.close();
				}
				windowOpen = window.open( jQuery( this ).attr( 'href' ), 'wpcomtwitter', 'menubar=1,resizable=1,width=600,height=350' );
				return false;
			});

<article id="post-4385" class="post-4385 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-games">
	<div class="article-wrap-inner">

					<div class="featured-thumb">
				<img width="1920" height="1082" src="https://tictechbuzz.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/LucasArts_Hero_NoCopy.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image />			</div>
		
		<div class="content-wrap">
			<div class="content-wrap-inner">
				<header class="entry-header">
					<h1 class="entry-title">Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</h1>					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="posted-on"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published updated" datetime="2020-10-17T00:01:36+00:00">October 17, 2020</time></a></span><span class="byline"> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://tictechbuzz.com/author/admin/">tictechbuzz</a></span></span><span class="cat-links"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/category/games/" rel="category tag">GAMES</a></span><span class="comments-link"><a href="https://tictechbuzz.com/remembering-the-classics-the-xbox-podcast-featuring-tim-schafer/#respond">No Comment<span class="screen-reader-text"> on Remembering The Classics: The Xbox Podcast Featuring Tim Schafer</span></a></span>					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->

				</header><!-- .entry-header -->
				
				<div class="entry-content">
					<p></p>
<div>
			<!-- .entry-social --></p>
<div class="entry-main entry-main--post entry-main--post-no-sidebar">
<p>The Legendary Tim Schafer stops by the Xbox Podcast and talks with Major Nelson about the Classic LucasArts Remasters coming to Xbox Game Pass.</p>
<figure class="wp-block-embed-youtube wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-embed-handler wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio">
<p>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe title="720: Tim Schafer, LucasArts Remasters and Bose gaming headphones" width="810" height="456" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgofIsxS_8k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></span>
</p>
</figure>
<p>As part of today’s show, Tim confirmed that the <strong>Classic LucasArts Remasters are coming October 29 to all Xbox Game Pass members</strong>, Xbox, Windows 10 PC, and Android (with Xbox Game Pass Ultimate). Fans will be able to play three beloved LucasArts adventure games – <em><strong>Grim Fandango Remastered</strong>, <strong>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</strong></em>, and <em><strong>Full Throttle Remastered</strong></em> – in their revitalized glory.</p>
<p>If you haven’t experienced these 1990s classics before, you have a lot of laughs and feelings to look forward to on October 29:</p>
<ul>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1993 as a sequel to Ron Gilbert’s ground breaking <em>Maniac Mansion</em>, <em><strong>Day of the Tentacle</strong></em> is a mind-bending, time travel, cartoon puzzle adventure game in which three unlikely friends work together to prevent an evil mutated purple tentacle from taking over the world!</li>
<li>Originally released by LucasArts in 1995, <em><strong>Full Throttle</strong></em> is a classic graphic adventure game from industry legend Tim Schafer, telling the story of Ben Throttle; butt-kicking leader of biker gang the Polecats, who gets caught up in a tale of Motorcycles, Mayhem, and Murder.</li>
<li>One of the most acclaimed adventure games of all time is now back, better than ever. <em><strong>Grim Fandango</strong>‘s</em> epic story of four years in the after-life of Manny Calavera, travel agent to the dead, has been remastered to look, sound, and control even better than when it won countless awards and was considered one of the best games of the year upon its original launch. <em>Grim Fandango</em> still stands as a classic of the genre, with unforgettable characters and unique combination of film noir and Mexican folklore.</li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to playing these classics, players can discover the freedom and flexibility cloud gaming that Xbox Game Pass Ultimate brings while playing these games. Because your Xbox profile resides in the cloud, you can easily continue the story that you began on your PC or Xbox console on your Android phone or tablet. Play <em>Full Throttle Remastered</em> during a real world road trip mirroring Ben’s journey in the game. If you can’t fly to Mexico, you can still visit Rubacava in <em>Grim Fandango Remastered</em>. When your kids are taking a break from Zoom, let them experience the writing of the Constitution in <em>Day of the Tentacle Remastered</em>.</p>
<p>If you’re not an Xbox Game Pass member but would like access to these three titles and over 100 high-quality games, new members can <a href="https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass">join Xbox Game Pass Ultimate today</a> for $1 for the first month, then $14.99 per month after that. Each game is also available for individual purchase at $14.99 USD.</p>
<p>Stay tuned to Xbox Wire for more on future fine Double Fine games like <em>Psychonauts 2</em> and others.</p>
</p></div>
<p><!-- .main-content -->
			</div>
<p><script>
	// Facebook Script.

				appId      : '451154101753332',
				xfbml      : true,
				version    : 'v2.12'
			});
		};</p>
<p>		(function(d, s, id){
			var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];

			js.src = "https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js";
			fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
		}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));
	});</p>
<p>	// Twitter Widget script
	XboxUtils.isCookieClear(function () {
		var tag = document.createElement('script');
			tag.src = "//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js";

			firstScriptTag.parentNode.insertBefore(tag, firstScriptTag);
	});</p>

In this adventure Peter Parker takes backstage, giving Miles a chance to shine as the lead. In the 2018 release, Insomniac put a focus on narrative and told an incredibly human story about loss and standing up for what’s right. var windowOpen;
			jQuery( document.body ).on( 'click', 'a.share-twitter', function() {
				// If there's another sharing window open, close it.
				if ( 'undefined' !== typeof windowOpen ) {
					windowOpen.close();
				}
				windowOpen = window.open( jQuery( this ).attr( 'href' ), 'wpcomtwitter', 'menubar=1,resizable=1,width=600,height=350' );
				return false;
			});
var windowOpen;

				// If there's another sharing window open, close it.

					windowOpen.close();
				}
